title: How to open a set of pages when opening Firefox
content:
When I open settings, under "start up" are only 2 options: 1. Open previous windows and tabs 2. Always check if Firefox is your default browser

There is no way to adjust which pages open when I open Firefox. What am I doing wrong here?
creator: abby9

title: My Lost Bookmarks

creator: jinxfire13

title: Newest upgrade of Firesox taxing my PC
content:
Having check my plug ins and everything else and found them to be OK. The newest upgrade to Firefox is running a very high CPU usage. I can hear the computer surging when it is running so high. Memory at times peaks at over 2000 MB on the task Manager. I'm sorry but I am not really good at explaining it.

Thank You

Sal Aguirre
creator: backfiretu95

title: creating desktop shortcuts via drag and drop
content:
My surface pro 7 with windows 10 or 11 will not create desktop shortcut from firefox (ver. 98.0.1 64 bit) using drag and drop with pen but will work using touch pad. I originally noticed this problem while running windows 11 on my surface pro 7. After doing some basic trouble shooting on my own I ended up re-imaging my surface pro 7 back to windows 10, I wasn't really thrilled with windows 11 anyway. At this point every thing worked normally. However, at some point firefox updated and the problem recurred. While using the touch pad is an acceptable work around when the keyboard is attached, using it as a tablet without the keyboard is a bit of an issue. Finger or pen is needed but won't work. thanks for your attention to this matter, it is appreciated. 

    Tom.
creator: grizmixstir

title: Firefox Android improperly zooming in cloud Outlook 365
content: I am using the cloud-based Outlook 365 app in Firefox Android. Every time I hit "New Message" to send an email, Firefox automatically zooms the page in, past the "Send Message" button. It seems to be auto-zooming to the "To:" line where the cursor flashes on this screen by default. When I type an email, the words are cut off, because the browser is zoomed into the text input area where I write the body of the email. When I try to un-zoom it, I can never get it to zoom all the way out properly again. When I exit the "New Message" screen to look at my inbox, it is still zoomed in and cutting text off. How do I fix this?
creator: adampatterson123

title: Can't turn off Two-step authentication
content: My Firefox account shows that Two-step authentication is "Not Set". However, Firefox sends me an email with a code and requires me to enter that in order to log in. I want to turn this off, so that when I type my password, I immediately log in to my account. How do I do this?
creator: adampatterson123
